page.title: 05Uyeasound Lighthouse.
page.content: The lighthouse is found on the Westside of Uyeasound. It is an automatic light which is attended by a part-time keeper who makes sure the light works properly. He sends a questionaire to the Northern Lighthouse Board in Edinburgh each month saying how much gas has been used,how much is left and the state of spares. The lighthouse uses acetylene gas to produce its beam which is visible for seven miles. The light flashes twice every 7 seconds.There is half second light,1 second dark,half second light,5 seconds dark. The Pole Star is the supply ship for lighthouses in Scotland. It calls every year bringing gas and other supplies. These are brought ashore by helicopter. In 1985 it will call on June 19th.
